Class ButtonEditor

java.lang.Object
javax.swing.AbstractCellEditor
javax.swing.DefaultCellEditor
ButtonEditor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, CellEditor, TableCellEditor, TreeCellEditor
public class ButtonEditor extends DefaultCellEditor
Cell editor for buttons in the table that allows for editing of values such as quantity, price, and employee roles
See Also:

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private void
    editValue()
    Opens an input dialog to edit the value based on the column type - If editing an employee role, it toggles between "Manager" and "Cashier" - If editing a quantity or price, prompts the user to enter a new value

    • ButtonEditor

      public ButtonEditor(JCheckBox checkBox, Connection conn, String columnType)
      Constructs a ButtonEditor with a specific database connection and column type

      checkBox - The checkbox component required by DefaultCellEditor
      conn - The database connection
      columnType - The type of data being edited

  • Method Details

    • getTableCellEditorComponent

      public Component getTableCellEditorComponent(JTable table, Object value, boolean isSelected, int row, int column)
      Returns the button component to be displayed in the table cell.
      Specified by:
      getTableCellEditorComponent in interface TableCellEditor
      Overrides:
      getTableCellEditorComponent in class DefaultCellEditor
      Parameters:
      table - The JTable that contains the cell
      value - The current value in the cell
      isSelected - Whether the cell is selected
      row - The row index of the cell
      column - The column index of the cell
      Returns:
      The button component for cell editing

    • editValue

      private void editValue()
      Opens an input dialog to edit the value based on the column type - If editing an employee role, it toggles between "Manager" and "Cashier" - If editing a quantity or price, prompts the user to enter a new value

    • toggleRole

      private void toggleRole(String employeeName)
      Toggles the employee role between "Manager" and "Cashier" and updates the database
      Parameters:
      employeeName - The name of the employee whose role is being changed

    • updateInventoryDatabase

      private void updateInventoryDatabase(String itemName, int newQuantity)
      Updates the inventory database with a new stock quantity.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item being updated
      newQuantity - The new quantity value

    • updatePriceDatabase

      private void updatePriceDatabase(String itemName, double newPrice)
      Updates the drink price in the database
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the drink being updated
      newPrice - The new price value

    • updateEmployeeDatabase

      private void updateEmployeeDatabase(String employeeName, String newRole)
      Updates the employee role in the database
      Parameters:
      employeeName - The name of the employee being updated
      newRole - The new role of the employee
